title: List of Cricket World Cup centuries
summary: In cricket, a player is said to have completed a century when he scores 100 or more runs in a single innings.[1] The Cricket World Cup is the international championship of One Day International (ODI) cricket. The event is organised by the sport's governing body, the International Cricket Council (ICC),[2] and is held once in every four years.[2][3] As of the 2019 tournament, a total of 196 centuries have been scored by 117 players from 15 different teams.[4] Players from all the teams that have permanent ODI status have made centuries.[lower-alpha 1] In addition, players from five teams that have temporary ODI status have scored centuries.[lower-alpha 2] The Indians have scored the most centuries (32), while Australia have the most centurions (15).[4]
